name: urlscan
description: View/select the URLs in an email message or file

repo.name: urlscan
repo.description: Mutt and terminal url selector (similar to urlview)

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with clear purpose, comprehensive installation steps, and good feature coverage, though lacking dedicated troubleshooting section and some examples could be more detailed.
readme.top_issue: No dedicated troubleshooting section; only mentions one specific Neomutt issue inline, leaving users to figure out other common problems on their own.

injection_risks.description: The --run and --run-safe options allow for command injection via user input
The subprocess module is used with shell=True which can lead to command injection

critical_findings: Command injection vulnerability via the --run and --run-safe options
Potential for terminal exploitation via the --colors option
security.summary: The urlscan package has several security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and potential for terminal exploitation.

common_complaints: Breaking changes between versions (1.0.6 to 1.0.7 macOS crash)
Limited color/display capabilities (256-color support, OSC 8/52 hyperlinks)
Regex filtering not working in NeoMutt context
Browser/application launching not respecting environment variables
praise_themes: Feature requests show active user interest
sentiment.summary: urlscan shows signs of maintenance challenges with unresolved platform-specific bugs, feature gaps in terminal functionality, and several closed issues suggesting fixes without recent activity, indicating moderate community concern despite acknowledged usefulness.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with users. However, there is room for more technical depth in some cases.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-02)
6 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicates no bug fixing
No merged pull requests in past 6 months shows no development activity
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release tracking is unavailable
positive_signals: Project has at least been touched at some point (last commit exists)
maintenance.summary: The urlscan package appears stale with no development activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement over the past 6 months despite having open issues that remain unaddressed.

project_metrics.description: Mutt and terminal url selector (similar to urlview)

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but could benefit from more concise language and additional troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Low commit frequency in the past six months
More open issues than closed ones
Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section or common problem solutions
Community: urlscan crashes when called from NeoMutt (on MacOS)
Community: Breaking change in 1.0.7 on macOS: urwid.raw_display.Screen()
Security: Command injection vulnerability via the --run and --run-safe options
Security: Potential for terminal exploitation via the --colors option
Security: The --run and --run-safe options allow for command injection via user input
High bus factor risk (87% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent merged PR within the last six months
Regular issue reporting and some resolution
